item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Marginalia – A search engine that prioritizes non-commercial content (125 points | 15 comments)
2. Kansas tuberculosis outbreak is now America's largest in recorded history (261 points | 185 comments)
3. Purelymail: Cheap Email for Everyone (22 points | 5 comments)
4. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (82 points | 20 comments)
5. The race for "AI Supremacy" is over – at least for now (27 points | 9 comments)
6. Lessons in creating family photos that people want to keep (2018) (75 points | 24 comments)
7. Shunpo: Minimalist bash tool to make directory navigation a little bit faster (33 points | 14 comments)
8. The leading AI models are now good historians (146 points | 103 comments)
9. Show HN: 3D printing giant things with a Python jigsaw generator (62 points | 8 comments)
10. The Less People Know About AI, the More They Like It (38 points | 29 comments)
11. Qwen2.5-1M: Deploy your own Qwen with context length up to 1M tokens (127 points | 61 comments)
12. The protester's guide to smartphone security (305 points | 158 comments)
13. Hyperbound (YC S23) is hiring a Founding Account Executive in SF ( | hide)
14. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (115 points | 29 comments)
15. Amsterdam Compiler Kit for Cray X-MP (50 points | 8 comments)
16. Show HN: DeepSeek My User Agent (221 points | 92 comments)
17. Astronomers delete asteroid because it turned out to be Tesla Roadster (166 points | 54 comments)
18. Autodesk partially restores old forum posts after outcry from the users (34 points | 4 comments)
19. OpenJazz is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games (43 points | 5 comments)
20. Dualities in Functional Programming (24 points | 3 comments)
21. The Microsoft 365 Copilot launch was a disaster (335 points | 318 comments)
22. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (384 points | 266 comments)
23. No one is disrupting banks – at least not the big ones (102 points | 165 comments)
24. Show HN: A new native app for 20 year old OS X (86 points | 18 comments)
25. So you wanna write Kubernetes controllers? (105 points | 58 comments)
26. Reviving a Dead Audio Format: The Return of ZZM (80 points | 5 comments)
27. The only photo of the Concorde flying at supersonic speed (104 points | 63 comments)
28. AI slop, suspicion, and writing back (205 points | 165 comments)
29. The South Vietnamese pilot who landed a Cessna on a carrier to save his family (2019) (351 points | 170 comments)
30. Two Bites of Data Science in K (24 points | 9 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 3:15 AM UTC
